subject: Re: [junit] Testing blocking methods..
msgSnippet: ... Here s a couple of pages that talk about testing a similar data structure: http://c2.com/cgi-bin/wiki?JavaUnitTestChallangeSolved.
messageBody:
Seetharam Samptur wrote:
>
> I'm using Junit for the first time and was experimenting it by writing
> test cases to test a Queue class. The methods in the Queue class are
> blocking on a queue. For ex: the get() method invokes wait() if the queue is
> empty. When a different thread invokes put() method and populates the queue,
> the get method is signaled and it returns the value.
> How can I test such a scenario?

Here's a couple of pages that talk about testing a similar data structure:

http://c2.com/cgi-bin/wiki?JavaUnitTestChallangeSolved.
http://c2.com/cgi-bin/wiki?ExtremeProgrammingChallengeFourteenSplit
